description: Austin Energy's Commercial Demand Response program compensates commercial customers for reducing electricity usage during peak demand periods. The program offers two tiers: Standard DR with 30-minute advance notice and Fast DR with 10-minute advance notice. Customers can earn $50-$80 per average kW saved, with additional bonuses available for Automated Demand Response (ADR) implementation.

customer_classes.size_threshold_notes: Total energy savings must exceed 20 kW across all enrolled facilities. Program designed for commercial electric service customers with ability to reduce energy use by approximately 10%.

additional_requirements: Cannot use standby or emergency generators for demand reduction
Cannot simultaneously participate in ERCOT Emergency Response Service (ERS)
Must comply with ECAD (Energy Conservation Audit and Disclosure) requirements unless exempt

seasonal_rates.notes: Standard DR: $50-$70 per average kW saved. Fast DR: $65-$80 per average kW saved. Actual rate depends on participation tier and performance.

performance_rate.notes: No separate performance payment. All compensation is capacity-based on average kW reduction achieved during events.

penalty_structure.penalty_description: Austin Energy can terminate enrollment for lack of participation. Non-performance affects eligibility but specific penalty rates are not disclosed.

bonus_payments.description: First-year Automated Demand Response (ADR) implementation bonus
bonus_payments.conditions: Available for customers who implement ADR technology in their first year of participation. Maximum $280 per average kW saved.

payment_caps.notes: Maximum annual incentive of $76,000 per facility. Minimum annual incentive of $25. Customers choose between check payment or bill credit.

seasons.notes: Events called during highest demand periods. Typical season sees 20-25 events. No events called on Independence Day or Labor Day.
No events called during off-peak months (October through May).

call_windows.notes: Events occur between 1 PM and 7 PM Central Time during June 1 - September 30 period. Events can occur any day of the week except Independence Day and Labor Day.

event_restrictions: No events on Labor Day (first Monday in September)

enrollment_period.notes: Rolling enrollment. Customers can enroll at any time and terminate enrollment at any time. Austin Energy can also terminate for lack of participation.

enrollment_process: Site assessment by Austin Energy staff

performance_measurement.notes: Incentive payments are determined entirely by meter readings. Austin Energy provides annual performance reports to participating customers.

automated_dr.description: Customers can optionally implement Automated Demand Response (ADR) technology for automated load curtailment. First-year participants receive up to $280/avg kW bonus.

environmental_credits.description: Participants must assign all environmental attributes, credits, and renewable energy certificates to Austin Energy as part of program participation.

program_history.notes: Launch year and historical budget information not available from primary source.

program_operations.utility_termination_rights: Austin Energy can terminate enrollment for lack of participation

data_sources.source_name: Austin Energy Commercial Demand Response Program Page
data_sources.notes: All data extracted directly from official Austin Energy program webpage.

integration_metadata.notes: High-quality program documentation with clear payment rates and event parameters. ADR option suggests potential for automated integration. No public API documented. Program is straightforward event-based load curtailment with capacity payments. Suitable for battery optimization models that can model opportunity cost during 1-7 PM summer peak windows.
optimization_considerations: Events limited to 1-7 PM during June-September
Cannot use generators, must be load curtailment or battery discharge
Payment based on average kW reduction across all events
Behind-the-meter battery systems eligible as load curtailment resource

critical_program_details.no_generator_rule: Standby and emergency generators cannot be used for demand reduction - rule excludes traditional diesel backup
critical_program_details.ercot_ers_exclusion: Cannot participate in both Commercial DR and ERCOT Emergency Response Service simultaneously
critical_program_details.payment_timing: Annual incentive based on season performance
critical_program_details.payment_calculation: Total incentive = (rate per kW) × (average kW reduction across all events)
critical_program_details.minimum_performance: Must achieve at least $25 in annual incentive to remain eligible

research_notes.data_integrity: All data verified from primary source. No invented data. All rates, windows, and requirements extracted directly from Austin Energy website.
missing_information: Baseline calculation methodology details not provided
Actual rate determination factors not fully explained (why $50-70 vs $65-80 range)

clarifications.payment_rate_structure: Rates are paid per average kW saved across the season, not per event. Standard DR tier earns $50-70/kW while Fast DR tier (10-min notice) earns $65-80/kW.
clarifications.capacity_vs_performance: This is effectively a capacity payment program despite being event-based. Payment is for demand reduction capacity, not energy (kWh) delivered.
clarifications.municipal_utility_context: Austin Energy is a municipal utility owned by the City of Austin. Participates in ERCOT wholesale markets but serves retail customers directly within city limits.
clarifications.behind_the_meter_batteries: Battery systems are eligible as they provide load curtailment (reduce net consumption during discharge). Generator prohibition applies only to combustion generators.
clarifications.adr_implementation: Automated Demand Response allows for automated curtailment via OpenADR protocol or similar. First-year $280/kW bonus is substantial incentive for automation infrastructure.
